meanings.definition: The ability to collapse or fall in on itself.
meanings.sent1: The collapsibility of the cardboard box made it easy to store.
meanings.sent2: The collapsibility of the tent allowed for quick packing during the camping trip.
meanings.sent3: The collapsibility of the umbrella surprised everyone when it folded up on its own.
meanings.sent4: The collapsibility of the building under construction was a concern for the engineers.
meanings.sent5: The collapsibility of the straw made it convenient to carry around.

meanings.definition: The state of being able to be easily folded or compressed.
meanings.sent1: The collapsibility of the fabric made it simple to pack in a small bag.
meanings.sent2: The collapsibility of the suitcase allowed for more items to be stored inside.
meanings.sent3: The collapsibility of the accordion amused the children as it expanded and contracted.
meanings.sent4: The collapsibility of the market stall symbolized adaptability in tough times.
meanings.sent5: The collapsibility of the plastic bottle made it convenient for recycling purposes.
